Package DBClientApp.controller

Class UpdateAppointmentController

java.lang.Object
DBClientApp.controller.UpdateAppointmentController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class UpdateAppointmentController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
UpdateAppointmentController class. This class handles the logic behind updating a customer. Methods of note are validateForm(), and the time instance sections. I would like to eventually turn that into a class for cleaner controllers.

    • onMouseMoved

      void onMouseMoved(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)

    • updateApptEDateClick

      void updateApptEDateClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      updateApptEDateClick. The action verifies the logic behind setting an end date, and sets the times for the end time combo box. If the end date is on the same day as the start day, the end times will reflect 5 minutes after the start time through to closing. Otherwise, they will be available for all business hours.
      Parameters:
      event -

    • updateApptETimeClick

      void updateApptETimeClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      updateApptETimeClick. This event verifies a logical end time and sets it.
      Parameters:
      event -

    • updateApptLocationClick

      void updateApptLocationClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      updateApptLocationCLick. This event calls the validateForm() method to assure data input.
      Parameters:
      event -

    • updateApptSDateClick

      void updateApptSDateClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      updateApptSDateClick. This event handles the logic behind picking a start date, and alerts on unaccessible dates. The event sets the times in the combobox according to the start date. If the start date is on the current day, only start times from then on are available. When adding an appointment, an appointment that spans days is not allowed. However, I built the update controller to allow for end date change, due to possible testing.
      Parameters:
      event -

    • updateApptSTimeClick

      void updateApptSTimeClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      updateApptSTimeClick This event adjusts for the current time if an appointment is chosen today, and alerts if closed. The method allows all business hours on any business day in the future. The method then sets the end time combobox with options that start 5 minutes after the start time. The last available start time is always 5 minutes prior to closing, to allow for a closing time end of meeting.
      Parameters:
      event -

    • updateApptSaveClick

      void updateApptSaveClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      updateApptSaveClick. This method uses logic to assure dates and times are properly input and won't overlap. The method verifies all data is input and cannot be enabled until the validateForm() call has returned true. The method then uses the AppointmentData class to modify the appointment data. On error the method alerts and returns to the form.
      Parameters:
      event -

    • validateForm

      private void validateForm()
      validateForm. This method is used to make sure all fields have been filled out and the date logic is sound. The save button cannot be clicked unless this method returns true.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      initialize. This method handles the logic of bringing in the data from the Main Menu, and applies it to the fields on the form. An instance of the current time was needed in order to set various logic checks, that rely on each other if another is chosen. For example, the times could not be chosen independently within the logic I used to fill the combo boxes.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url -
      resourceBundle -
